trans-unit.source: Azure Plugin for Eclipse with Java (by Microsoft Open Technologies)
trans-unit.target: Azure Plugin for Eclipse with Java (by Microsoft Open Technologies)

trans-unit.source: Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows Server 2008, or Windows Server 2012.
trans-unit.target: Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows Server 2008, or Windows Server 2012.

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, from the **Help** menu, select **Install New Software**.
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, from the **Help** menu, select **Install New Software**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the site location <http://dl.msopentech.com/eclipse> and press **Enter**.
trans-unit.target: Enter the site location <http://dl.msopentech.com/eclipse> and press **Enter**.

trans-unit.source: Select the items to be installed and click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Select the items to be installed and click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: This plugin uses the latest version of the Azure SDK.
trans-unit.target: This plugin uses the latest version of the Azure SDK.

trans-unit.source: This can be downloaded using the Web Platform Installer (WebPI) at <http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=252838>.
trans-unit.target: This can be downloaded using the Web Platform Installer (WebPI) at <http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=252838>.

trans-unit.source: However, if you don't have it installed, when you create your first Azure deployment project, the Azure Plugin for Eclipse with Java (by Microsoft Open Technologies) will automatically install the appropriate version of the Azure SDK.
trans-unit.target: However, if you don't have it installed, when you create your first Azure deployment project, the Azure Plugin for Eclipse with Java (by Microsoft Open Technologies) will automatically install the appropriate version of the Azure SDK.
